intro: Schoenoplectiella × osoreyamensis, commonly known as the Osoreyamensis sedge, is a hybrid plant species native to Japan. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and spike-like flower clusters. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Due to its limited distribution and unique genetic composition, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
